name: aggressively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 in an angry and violent way: Small children often behave aggressively. Many drivers behave aggressively on the road at some point.
in a determined and forceful way in order to achieve success or win: They played more aggressively in the second half. The company is aggressively pursuing new business opportunities.
medical
  specialized in a way that develops very quickly: His prostate cancer had grown aggressively beyond the prostate and surrounding tissue. In recent years, the disease has aggressively attacked her voice and memory.
medical
  specialized in a way that uses a very strong treatment in order to cure a disease: We may have to treat the seizures aggressively to prevent developmental delays. For how long and how aggressively should treatment be applied?
More examplesFewer examplesThe puppy was growling aggressively.The music festival is now marketed aggressively around the country. West Nile virus spreads most aggressively during the summer and early autumn.Older people with serious conditions can be treated as aggressively as if they were much younger.
